page.title: 05Disused Pits and Tips
page.content: Much of the area to the north of the villages of Trewoon and Lanjeth has been involved with the China Clay Industry. A large proportion of the area is now no longer used. There are many old pits, tips and buildings which are now disused or derelict. The waste product of Clay production is mainly sand, which is dumped on tips, or a fine sludge which is left to settle in large lakes. Both of these materials are almost pure white which is why the 'White Pyramids' area is used so often for Science Fiction films. In recent years much research has been done into how to reclaim or restore the landscape to its natural beauty. Many old tips in the area are now covered with green plants which can grow in such conditions. Even the lakes can be refilled and re-used for agricultural purposes. (Mike Yates)
